children.name: when a mode of transport arrives
arrive
children.definition: đến
examples: What timedoes his flight arrive?
The train isn’t due to arrive until 4.30.
We liked to watch the cruise ships come in.
arrive at/in/from
Our flight arrived in Osaka two hours ahead of schedule.
Supply ships have started arriving at ports along the East coast

children.name: get in
children.definition: to arrive-use this when you are talking about the time when a train, ship, or plane arrives: đến nơi (lúc mấy giờ)
examples: What time does your flight get in?
Hopefully the bus will get in by 8 o'clock.
What time is the plane expected to get in?
What time did your plane get in?
get in to
The ferry gets in to Harwich around noon

children.name: come in
children.definition: if a plane, ship, or train comes in, it arrives in the place where you arewaiting:đến
examples: Has the Air India flight come in yet?
Crowds had gathered at the harbour to watch the ship come in
Hasn't his train comeinyet?

children.name: pull in
children.definition: if atrain,car, orbuspulls in, it arrives at thestationor the place where you arewaiting:đến ( trạm , hay nơi ai đó đang đợi )
examples: Finally the bus pulled in, forty minutes late.
Just as the train was pulling in, there was a shout and someone fell onto the track.

children.name: be in
children.definition: if you say that aplane,trainorshipis in, it has arrived at the airport, station etc where you are waiting:đến
examples: Their plane’s in, but it’ll take them a little while to get through customs.
As her train wasn’t in yet, she went to the bookstall and flipped through the magazines

children.name: to arrive by plane, boat, etc
land
children.definition: to arrive somewhere in a plane, boat etc: hạ cánh, cập bến
examples: We finally landed at 2 a.m.
land on/in/at etc
We expect to be landing in Oslo in about fifty minutes.
In 1969, the first men landed on the Moon.
We landed at Port Said in the early evening.

children.name: hit
children.definition: informalto arrive at a place :
examples: They hit the main road two kilometres further on.
If we turn left at the next junction, we should hit the main road after five miles or so.
hit townAmerican English:
I’ll look for work as soon as I hit town.

children.name: arrive
children.definition: if someone or something arrives, they get to the place they were going to: đến
examples: Give me a call to let me know you’ve arrived safely.
arrive in/at/ from
What time does the plane arrive in New York?
When Uncle Guy arrived from Dublin he brought them an enormous box of chocolates.
arrive late/early
He arrived late as usual.
By the time the policearrived on the scene,the burglars had fled.
►Do not say ‘arrive to’ a place. Sayarrive in/ata place :We arrived at the station ten minutes early.|The Prime Minister arrives back in Britain tonight.
arrive here/there/back/home
When I first arrived here none of the other students would talk to me.
Jo should arrive home any minute now.
arrive early/lateI don’t think we should arrive early.
arrive on timeHe never arrives on time for meetings.
arrive safelyShe phoned to say she had arrived safely.
arrive shortly/soonMy parents are due to arrive shortly.
arrive unannounced(= without anyone expecting or knowing you were coming )He arrived unannounced yesterday and stayed the night.
arrive safe and sound(= safely )It was a great relief when he arrived back safe and sound.
arrive on the scene(= at the place where sth has just happened)Two more police cars arrived on the scene.

children.name: get
children.definition: especially spoken if you get to a place, you reach it.Getis much more common in everyday English thanarrive: tới
examples: get to
By the time we got to New York, it was snowing.
get home/here/there
What time did you get home last night?
We'll never get there in time.
What time do you usually get home in the evening?
get as far as
We only got as far as the end of the road, then the car broke down.
get back toreturn to
I’ll call her when I get back to Chicago.

children.name: appear
children.definition: xuất hiện
examples: We were just having breakfast when Amy appeared.
If she hasn't appeared by ten o'clock I'm going without her.
appear at/in/from
Neil appeared at my house around 9 o'clock.
All these people seem to have appeared from nowhere.

children.name: come along
children.definition: if sb or sth comes along, it arrives, especially in a way that isunexpectedor slightlyunusual:đến, xuất hiện, có mặt (bất ngờ, bất bình thường)
examples: We were having a good time until Ronnie came along.
Bill and I waited an hour for a bus, and then four of them came along at once.

children.name: talk of the devil
children.definition: UK /speak of the devilUS say this when sb you are talking about or have just mentioned comes into the room or arrives unexpectedly:vừa mới nhắc tới
examples: Talk of the devil! I was just telling everyone about your promotion.
Let’s ask Amy what she thinks - speak of the devil, here she is!

children.name: show up
children.definition: /turn upB2 to arrivewithout warning, especially when it isdifficultor notconvenientfor other people:đến, xuất hiện (ko báo trước nên gây bất tiện)
examples: Brian has a habit of turning up just at the wrong moment
At midnight Joanne’s boyfriend showed up drunk.

children.name: able to reach by a mode of transport
accessible
children.definition: easily reached, especially by car, boat, plane etc:có thể đến được ,tiếp cận được ,tới được
examples: easily accessible
We chose to live in this area because both New York and Boston are easily accessible fromhere.
The banks of the River Holbeck are easily accessible to walkers and anglers.
accessible by boat/plane etc
Because of the snow, many parts of the countryside are only accessible by helicopter.

children.name: inaccessible
children.definition: difficult or impossible to reachOPP accessible:
examples: In winter, the villages are inaccessible by road.
The country consists mainly of dense jungles and inaccessible mountain ranges.
inaccessible to
A long flight of stairs made the center inaccessible to disabled visitors.
The bathroom is situated at the top of a flight of stairs, making it inaccessible to the disabled.

children.name: to arrive swh without intending to
end up
children.definition: /fetch upUK informal  to arrive in a place that you didnot intend to go to: cuối cùng lại đến (nơi bạn không dự định đến)
examples: end up in/at
I fell asleep on the bus and ended up in Denver.
I thought we were going straight home, but we all ended up at Tom’s place.
After a whole hour of driving, we fetched up back where we started.

children.name: come to
children.definition: to arrive at a place during a journey without knowingthat you would arrive there:đến (1 nơi bạn ko nghĩ là bạn lại đến đó trong 1 hành trình)
examples: We were walking through the woods when we came to a waterfall.
Ian stopped at the next house he came to and asked to use the phone.

children.name: find yourself
children.definition: in/at etc torealizethat you have arrived somewherewithout intending to:nhận ra mình đang ở (1 nơi bạn không hề nghĩ tới trước đó)
examples: After wandering around, we found ourselves back at the hotel.
Sammler opened a big glass door and found himself in an empty lobby.

children.name: to arrive at a place where sb is waiting
come
children.definition: if sb or sth comes, they arrive at the place where you arewaitingfor them:đến
examples: When the visitors come, send them up to my office.
Has the mail come yet?
My mother’s saying she won’t come if Richard’s here.
When does the post come?
come home/back
▪ What time is Dad coming home?

children.name: be here
children.definition: spoken use this to say that sb has arrived at the place where you are waiting for them: đây rồi ( ý nói đến rồi )
examples: Susan, your friends are here.
Is Andy here yet?
Here they are. Go and open the door, will you?

children.name: to arrive swh later than expected
show up
children.definition: /turn upB2 informal to arrive-use this about sb you are expecting to arrive, especially when they arrive late : đến trễ
examples: Some of the people I invited never showed up.
If Tina shows up, tell her we waited as long as we could.
I’d arranged to meet Tom, but he never turned up.
Steve turned up half an hour late as usual.

children.name: roll in
children.definition: informal if sb rolls in, they arrive somewhere later than they should and do not seem worried about it - often used humorously: đến (thong dong, thảnh thơi)
examples: Chris finally rolled in at about 4:00 am.
Rebecca usually rolls in around noon.

children.name: get in
children.definition: to arrive somewhere – used especially about people arriving home, especially when you are later than expected or usual: về
examples: What time did you get in last night?
Mark just got in a few minutes ago.

children.name: get through
children.definition: to succeed in reaching a particular place, after muchdangeranddifficulty:vượt qua
examples: Heavy rains have prevented food supplies from getting through.
get through to
Rescue teams finally got through to the survivors by digging a tunnel.

children.name: make
children.definition: informal tosucceedin reaching a place, especially by a particular time:đếnđược
examples: We’ll be lucky if we make San Fernando by nightfall.
The team aimed to make the South Pole and back in a month.

children.name: make it
children.definition: informalespecially spoken to arrive somewherein timefor sth, when you werenot sureyou would:đến
examples: If we don’t make it on time, start without us
make it to
We just made it to the hospital before the baby arrived.
The roads were so bad that I wasn’t sure we would make it.
If we run, we should be able to make it before the bus leaves.
make it to/across/home etc
Even though he couldn’t swim, he managed to make it to the riverbank.
Thousands of refugees made it across the border.
With blood pouring from his leg, he made it to a nearby house.

children.name: reach
children.definition: to arrive at a place, especially after alongordifficultjourney:đếnđược
examples: It took more than three days to reach the top of the mountain.
Snow prevented workers from reaching the broken pipeline.
We didn’t reach the hotel until midnight.
Some letters are taking up to two weeks to reach their destination.
In winter, parts of Northern Canada can only be reached by plane.
We reached London late at night.
The pyramids can be reached by public transport.
RegisterIn everyday English, people often useget torather thanreach:
Wegot tothe airport just in time.
You canget tothe pyramids by public transport.
